com.thinkaurelius.titan.core

Interface TitanGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.KeyIndexableGraph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.ThreadedTransactionalGraph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.TransactionalGraph
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardTitanGraph, TitanBlueprintsGraph

    public interface TitanGraph
extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.KeyIndexableGraph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.ThreadedTransactionalGraph
    Titan graph database implementation of the Blueprint's interface. Use TitanFactory to open and configure TitanGraph instances.
    Author:
    Matthias Bröcheler (http://www.matthiasb.com)
    See Also:
    TitanFactory, TitanTransaction

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.tinkerpop.blueprints.TransactionalGraph

    • Method Detail

      • newTransaction

        TitanTransaction newTransaction()
        Opens a new thread-independent TitanTransaction.

        The transaction is open when it is returned but MUST be explicitly closed by calling TitanTransaction.commit() or TitanTransaction.rollback() when it is no longer needed.

        Note, that this returns a thread independent transaction object. It is not necessary to call this method to use Blueprint's standard transaction framework which will automatically start a transaction with the first operation on the graph.

        Specified by:
        newTransaction in interface com.tinkerpop.blueprints.ThreadedTransactionalGraph
        Returns:
        Transaction object representing a transactional context.

      • buildTransaction

        TransactionBuilder buildTransaction()
        Returns a TransactionBuilder to construct a new thread-independent TitanTransaction.
        Returns:
        a new TransactionBuilder
        See Also:
        TransactionBuilder, newTransaction()

      • getManagementSystem

        TitanManagement getManagementSystem()
        Returns the management system for this graph instance. The management system provides functionality to change global configuration options, install indexes and inspect the graph schema.

        The management system operates in its own transactional context which must be explicitly closed.

        Returns:

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Checks whether the graph is still open.
        Returns:
        true, if the graph is open, else false.
        See Also:
        shutdown()

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
              throws TitanException
        Closes the graph database.

        Closing the graph database causes a disconnect and possible closing of the underlying storage backend and a release of all occupied resources by this graph database. Closing a graph database requires that all open thread-independent transactions have been closed - otherwise they will be left abandoned.

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface com.tinkerpop.blueprints.TransactionalGraph
        Throws:
        TitanException - if closing the graph database caused errors in the storage backend

      • getVertexLabel

        VertexLabel getVertexLabel(String name)
        Returns the vertex label with the given name. If a vertex label with this name does not exist, the label is automatically created through the registered DefaultSchemaMaker.

        Attempting to automatically create a vertex label might cause an exception depending on the configuration.

        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:

        Creates a new vertex in the graph with the vertex label named by the argument.
        Parameters:
        vertexLabel - the name of the vertex label to use
        Returns:
        a new vertex in the graph created in the context of the current transaction

      • query

        TitanGraphQuery<? extends TitanGraphQuery> query()
        Returns a TitanGraphQuery to query for vertices or edges in the graph by their properties.
        Specified by:
        query in interface com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph
        Returns:

      • indexQuery

        TitanIndexQuery indexQuery(String indexName,
                         String query)
        Returns a TitanIndexQuery to query for vertices or edges against the specified indexing backend using the given query string. The query string is analyzed and answered by the underlying storage backend.

        Note, that using indexQuery may ignore modifications in the current transaction, i.e. the query is not transactionally bound.

        Parameters:
        indexName - Name of the indexing backend to query as configured
        query - Query string
        Returns:
        TitanIndexQuery object to query the index directly

      • multiQuery

        TitanMultiVertexQuery multiQuery(TitanVertex... vertices)
        Returns a TitanMultiVertexQuery to query for vertices or edges on multiple vertices simultaneously. This is similar to TitanVertex.query() but for multiple vertices at once. Hence, this query method is often significantly faster when executing identical TitanVertexQuery on multiple vertices.
        Parameters:
        vertices -
        Returns:

      • multiQuery

        TitanMultiVertexQuery multiQuery(Collection<TitanVertex> vertices)
        Returns a TitanMultiVertexQuery to query for vertices or edges on multiple vertices simultaneously. This is similar to TitanVertex.query() but for multiple vertices at once. Hence, this query method is often significantly faster when executing identical TitanVertexQuery on multiple vertices.
        Parameters:
        vertices -
        Returns:
